channel.title: Spontanious Code
channel.description:
I need Help, With Expert Coders here is an code I want to be in the game:
if (absX >= XXXX && absY >= XXXX) { [Will this code operate like an AutoMatic Teleporter?]
Then Something Like this would happen -
SM("You have been TelePorted to Jail") Or SM("You have been Inflicted with Great Damage") Or An Detection of someone Glitching; An Message that goes to everyone: "Username is out of Diameter" the Casual Code Activations
So I don't know if I'm using the Code Correction:
Main Purpose: I want to know because I want to make Traps =)

item.title: Spontanious Code
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Put this in process() or walking packet (don’t know the id :S) :

if (absX == XXXX && absY == XXXX) { teleportToX = JAILX; teleportToY = JAILY; SM("You have been TelePorted to Jail"); }

^^ That may not work, upload your client.java and I will code it in for you
I owe a lot to this community.

Read full topic

item.title: Spontanious Code
item.dc:creator: @Rene_eats_waffl3z Rene eats waffl3z
item.description:
@Rene_eats_waffl3z wrote:

Well, you’ve put this.
if (absX >= XXXX && absY >= XXXX) {
So that means if (absX >= XXXX && absY >= XXXX) {
then
… happens.
and then you put

SM(“You have been TelePorted to Jail”)
Or
SM(“You have been Inflicted with Great Damage”)
Or
An Detection of someone Glitching;
An Message that goes to everyone: “Username is out of Diameter”
the Casual Code Activations

But that would send the messages, but not teleport him somewhere. Make a post for extra explanation, hope this helped?

Read full topic
